reviews.review_msg: Boring lectures, but interesting material. Really nice woman who, when relating material to her work as a therapist or showing particular videos, can be very interesting. Hard exams.
reads off ppt slides word for word, voice so monotone and boring, it'll be the best 3 hr nap of your life. class not recommended unless required.

Came here before signing up and the exams and not easy/fair... the multichoice is REALLY hard and could be based on any one unimportant sentence in the 300 plus pages of content for test. Written based on main concepts though and evens it out. Only take if you REALLY want to. She is quiet and a bit boring. TA marks fast and well. Text entensive.

Dagmar is awesome and her exams are fair/easy. She has some interesting real-life examples because she works as a therapist as well. She shows a lot of video clips that are engaging and uses material right from the textbook. Love this class.

She's sweet and tries too engage students, but unfortunately doesn't really succeed. The lecture is so boring and lags on forever. Exams are textbook based, but will have some questions on the in-class videos (very few though). Textbook chapters are ridiculously long and full of useless information. Exams are pretty hard; memorize the textbook.

Found her extremely dull and lazy. She literally reads her slides word for word. I didn't go to class for over a month and did better than average on the midterm. MC part of tests are ridiculous, and destroyed my entire class. Also, the textbook is wordy, long, and fairly uninteresting. Very disappointing.
Excellent prof, she knows what she is doing, and does her best to make sure you are prepared for her exams. I would take ANY class with this prof. Her exams are for the most part, very fair.

She's okay, but her exams are based all on memorization. If you use an example that's not from the notes you'll get it wrong. Basically, she tests on how well you memorized her notes. Her TA isn't that good either.

I LOVE this class, for someone who is interested in mental disorders/abnormal psych, u will love this. The prof tells us stories about her clients because she works as a therapist too, and they're so interesting. She is clear, the exams FAIR. Plays interesting videos like from Modern Family, relevant to course. Best 200 level course imo. I love her

Dr. Bernstein is awesome! Her lectures are interesting even though she just reads off the slides. Her exams are fair; short-answers are easy but MC are a little tricky (since it is from the textbook test bank)

Liked this prof- she uses power points & lots of videos to supplement (but not tested on) her notes. Exams were pretty much out of the textbook- attendance is not mandatory but she makes it interesting. TA's marked HARD, maybe cus she marked it within 3 days?

The material of this course is pretty easy, very similar to introductory abnormal psyc. However, her exams were sometimes difficult because she uses a bank of questions from the textbook. They are very picky questions, do the practice ones online. Short answers are very easy though. Either way, class is curved so just do better than everyone else.

I really enjoyed her method of teaching, she was spunky and used lots of clips to illustrate points! I disliked how she used test banks from the textbook for exams, and the performance of the class on the MC was quite low.
